programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team work on a golden retriever with a broken leg, rushed into the clinic by its devastated owner, and also treat a beagle injured in a vicious dog attack

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: The team is faced with an overweight cat with kidney disease that needs a miracle if it is going to survive. Dr Jeff also battles to save a dog hit by a car

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps Tara, whose cat will not tolerate strangers, and Kurt, whose feline companion destroys or eats everything in sight

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: Footage of animals, featuring a balloon-popping bulldog who thinks everything belongs to her and a cat that steals from everyone in its neighbourhood

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: A game of underwater copycat shows how smart dolphins really are. Plus, how hyenas can eat pretty much anything and geckos ability to apparently defy gravity

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.sub-title: Space Bugs and Squirrel Mind Maps
programme.desc: A squirrels ability to hide up to 10,000 nuts in one season - and still find them again. Plus, alligators fondness for music and whether a bug can survive in space

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun travels to La Conner to rescue Play-Play, whose distraught owner watches nearly 70 feet below, while Tom is called out on a late-night mission

programme.desc: The wardens go on night patrol, seeking out anglers fishing over the limit, and using a special dog unit to help sniff out illegal items

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Denver vet Dr Jeff helps an injured tiger at a wild animal sanctuary. Dr Amy tackles exploratory surgery on a cat with a strange appetite

programme.desc: Deep in Kentucky, Mireya and Ronny encounter unidentified creatures responding to the recording of a Bigfoot howl

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Eve experiences her first deer hunt on Afognak Island, Otto must move the outhouse due to frozen soil and Atz gathers trees for a new project

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack seizes an opportunity to stockpile meat with their first-ever buffalo hunt. Noah and Bam are left behind to build a mine-cooled meat locker

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: With a team member down, Russell and Mireya must forge ahead to hunt down leads, and their investigations uncover their first pieces of potential evidence

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the fishing village of Port Isaac in Cornwall, discovering a place where people exploited a range of natural resources to make a living and find profits far beyond Britains shores

programme.title: Matthew Bournes Nutcracker!
programme.desc: A contemporary take on the classic Christmas ballet, featuring Tchaikovskys much-loved score, Anthony Wards sets and costumes, and dazzling choreography by Matthew Bourne. The story follows Claras bittersweet journey from a darkly comic Christmas Eve at Dr Drosss Orphanage, through a shimmering, ice-skating winter wonderland to the candy kingdom of Sweetieland, influenced by the lavish Hollywood musicals of the 1930s

programme.title: Jools Hollands New Orleans Jukebox
programme.desc: The pianist introduces a showing of his 1985 documentary Walking to New Orleans, which featured appearances from his Tube co-host Paula Yates, actor Robbie Coltrane and Squeeze drummer Gilson Lavis, with performances from New Orleans jazz and blues legends including Fats Domino, Johnnie Allan, Lee Dorsey, the Gospel Soul Children choir and the Neville Brothers. Jools reveal the stories behind the making of the film and also celebrates the music that has inspired him throughout his life and revisits some of his favourite performances from the BBC archives, with artists including Mahalia Jackson, Chris Barber and Ottilie Patterson, Louis Armstrong, Irma Thomas, Allen Toussaint and Trombone Shorty

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith explores the subject of large corporations, asserting that they are the most relentless force for change in modern economic life

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith explores why so many people live poverty, confronting the tragedy of the landless poor and searching for a solution in the worldwide migration to the cities

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the fishing village of Port Isaac in Cornwall, discovering a place where people exploited a range of natural resources to make a living and find profits far beyond Britains shores

programme.title: Matthew Bournes Nutcracker!
programme.desc: A contemporary take on the classic Christmas ballet, featuring Tchaikovskys much-loved score, Anthony Wards sets and costumes, and dazzling choreography by Matthew Bourne. The story follows Claras bittersweet journey from a darkly comic Christmas Eve at Dr Drosss Orphanage, through a shimmering, ice-skating winter wonderland to the candy kingdom of Sweetieland, influenced by the lavish Hollywood musicals of the 1930s

programme.title: Earths Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: How animals and plants deal with the changes in the environment that occur every autumn. As summer ends, animals have to prepare for the winter ahead. Chipmunks and beavers hurry to hoard their winter supplies before the weather grows colder, while musk oxen and beetles find they only have one more chance to mate before the year is out and young gannets face the first dangerous challenge of their lives. Narrated by Andrew Scott

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists has compiled the evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in mans knowledge of the bluestones of Stonehenge. By combining innovative 3D scanning techniques, traditional field archaeology and novel laboratory analysis, the team has discovered where the stones were quarried and where they first stood. Professor Alice Roberts shows how the team made its discoveries and joins Professor Mike Parker Pearson to piece together the final parts of the puzzle, solving one of the toughest challenges ever faced by archaeologists

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presides over another duel of words and wits as Frank Muir, Joanna Lumley and Russell Harty take on Patrick Campbell, Nanette Newman and Bryan Forbes. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 1977

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1993 documentary exploring three decades of Soviet space culture,from the glory days of Yuri Gagarin to the saga of cosmonaut Sergei Krikalev, whose return from the Mir space station was delayed due to the dissolution of the Soviet Union

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: An edition from 2007 celebrating the first 150 years of the Tube, the worlds oldest underground railway system and a peculiarly British institution used by three million people every day. Through poetry, music and film, the stories of passengers and drivers are woven into reconstructions of the networks history, beginning with a public hanging in 1863 and including its wartime use as a massive air raid shelter

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Hubert Dreyfus to examines the principles developed by Edmund Husserl, Martin Heidegger and other modern existentialist philosophers such as Jean-Paul Sartre and Maurice

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Sidney Morgenbesser to discuss the work of CS Pierce, John Dewey and William James, known collectively as the American pragmatists

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 1977

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists has compiled the evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in mans knowledge of the bluestones of Stonehenge. By combining innovative 3D scanning techniques, traditional field archaeology and novel laboratory analysis, the team has discovered where the stones were quarried and where they first stood. Professor Alice Roberts shows how the team made its discoveries and joins Professor Mike Parker Pearson to piece together the final parts of the puzzle, solving one of the toughest challenges ever faced by archaeologists

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents the political developments of the week, with policy-makers questioned on the key issues

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Mehreen Baig discuss people receiving benefits without having to look for work, a man inspired to build a brick wall, and the healing power of cake

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: Communal worship in Punjabi from the Sikh gurdwara in Roath, Cardiff, including sung sacred text and devotional singing. With contributions from volunteer teachers of Punjabi and religious education in the gurdwara school

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the team pay a visit to a very wet and windy Newark Runway antiques fair. Lending a hand to the teams are Charles Hanson and Phillip Serrell

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Louisa Lytton presents an appeal on behalf of Retina UK, a charity dedicated to providing support and information for those living with inherited sight loss, and funding research into potential treatments

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher is in London to meet Bear Grylls, who reflects upon his faith and favourite hymns and pays a visit to Saint Pauls Hammersmith to admire the church artwork

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Documentary about four rival families - leopards, hyenas, wild dogs and lions - trying to claim a rich corner of Zambia as their home. Leopard mother Olimbas world is turned upside down by the arrival of Wild Dog Storm and her chaotic pack. But just when the dogs are beginning to settle into the Kingdom and welcome a litter of puppies, an even more powerful force appears on the horizon - lions. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: The Mask
programme.desc: A timid bank clerk stumbles on an ancient mask, which endows whoever wears it with untold superhuman powers, unbridled self-confidence and an irresistible charm for the ladies. Unfortunately, he earns the enmity of a local gangster for daring to flirt with his girlfriend - and when the crook gets wind of the artefacts existence, he covets the power for himself. Fantasy comedy, with Jim Carrey, Cameron Diaz, Peter Riegert and Peter Greene

programme.title: Children in Need
programme.desc: Pudsey joins Holly Hamilton and Connor Phillips as they meet some of the organisations and young people that benefit from BBC Children in Need. Pudsey travels to Omagh for the Children in Need choir, and Cate Conway joins Connor for a three-legged walk from Portadown to Newry

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin helps an ambitious conservation project to release three wildcats back into the wild in the Scottish Highlands. Under cover of darkness, he watches as the rare and elusive predators take their first steps towards freedom. Plus, a look back through the Countryfile archives to revisit others working to restore and protect Britains wild side

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: As the wet season transforms Nsefu into a lush green paradise, Storms wild dog pups must learn to navigate their new, flooded world. When their mother gives birth to a second litter, disaster strikes and the dogs place in the kingdom hangs in the balance. Leopard mother Olimba clashes with her daughter, who is forced to grow up fast. The lion prides dominance intensifies, with devastating consequences for the hyena clan

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: With Blackpool just six days away, Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman reveal which two celebrities have to compete in the dance-off, knowing one of them wont be making their way to the home of ballroom dancing next week. Featuring music from Olly Murs and the professionals teaming up with Diversity for a performance

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce visits the National Waterfront Museum in Swansea, where rugby legend Gareth Edwards has brought along some treasured items from his illustrious career. Fiona also takes a look at some personal items belonging to Dylan Thomas, while the experts value a watercolour by childrens illustrator Margaret Tarrant, a dress that may have been worn at a famous ball before the battle of Waterloo, and a violin used to escape from a prisoner of war camp

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: Beth does everything she can to reconcile Tom and Kitty, but everyones still struggling. Holly finds a clever way to deal with Rudy, and when the Riot Women make their first proper recording, she gets an eye-popping surprise. Kitty finally goes to court for trashing Gavins Jag, and former gangland boss Keith Eckersley (Jonathan Pryce) makes an unexpected appearance, with life-changing news for Kitty

programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby
programme.desc: Bridgets focus on single life and her career is interrupted when she finds herself pregnant, but with one hitch - she can only be 50 per cent sure of the identity of her babys father after a pair of one-night stands. Is the dad old flame Mark Darcy or US dating guru Jack Qwant? Comedy sequel, starring Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth, Patrick Dempsey, Emma Thompson and Sally Phillips

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends games in the Super League, including Liverpool v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal and Manchester City v Manchester United

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Insurer Says Im Wrong About Having Cancer
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Louise Minchin investigate the life insurance policies that have left viewers ineligible for a payout while battling serious health conditions, including one company refusing to accept a woman has cancer. Plus, the new parking schemes that could spell the end for airport scammers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former care centre is converted into a smart family home in Waterlooville, developers sort out a house with subsidence in West Bromwich and a refurbished semi-detached home is given as a gift in Birkenhead

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks help the teams search for bargains at Stoneleigh antiques fair to sell in Derby. Eric Knowles meets the son of Jamaican-born weightlifter Louis Martin

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: A scammer pretending to be from a mobile phone company targets a woman who is desperate to get to a doctors appointment. He promises her a free gift of Apple AirPods, but he is just after the money in her bank account. With so much at stake, the team have just a small window of time to try to intercept the call

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Richard from Bolton wants to create a pyrography business at home so he can be around more for his son. His mentor Eben thinks the key to his success as a heat-applied decorator might come from collaborating with a whisky distillery. Connie, from Co Down, wants to push herself outside of her comfort zone and properly establish an embroidery business. Mentor Stephanie thinks she has the talent and potential to do well, but needs to define herself as an animal artist for success. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson visits the Isle of Man to find a new home for a retired nurse who knows the island better than he does. They take a trip on the Snaefell Mountain Railway

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam are in to Chesterfield transform a steep weed-filled garden into a healing space for Finn and Miriam, who is recovering from cancer.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Phil Serrell and Tahmina Ghaffar begin a journey across Merseyside and Cheshire, snapping up a Mexican hat pig feeder and a delicately hand-painted Chinese glass bottle

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When one of the lads in a local rugby team is attacked, Donal wonders if its a case of jealousy between the players or whether theres something more serious going on. Marlene and Eve arent getting on, so when Marlene sees Eves husband looking intimate with another woman, she wonders what she should do. Cameron Cuffe, Kerri Quinn and Tara Lynne ONeill star

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: Cookstown Railway Station in Co Tyrone was once a thriving transport hub, connecting this rural community to the cities and beyond closed to passengers in 1956. Nowadays it is the home of Cookstown Hockey Club, retaining its place at the heart of Cookstown life

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vicki struggles to cope after hearing that Joel is pleading not guilty, while Suki and Eve try to broker peace between Ravi and the family ahead of the adoption assessment. At the Vics quiz night, Zoe decides to play matchmaker between Freddie and Anna

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Britain and China: Following the Money - Panorama
programme.desc: Britain faces a huge challenge in its relationship with China. Can it do business with a rising superpower while keeping the UK safe? Reporter Celia Hatton has been following Chinese state money that flowed into UK business over the last two decades. With access to new research, and interviews with those at the heart of key deals, she reveals how the state was far more active than may have been realised at the time. Was the UK outsmarted by Beijings long-term planning? And what does it tell us about how Britain reckons with Chinas power today?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Singer and actor Antony Costa, Paralympian and actor Gaz Choudhry, drag artist Ginger Johnson, actress Katie McGlynn and reality star Uma Jammeh compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. Judges Grace Dent and John Torode challenge them to make a dish using a secret ingredient, before a blindfold test in which they must identify cubes of meat, fish or fruit by touch and taste only. Finally, they have one hour to cook a dish for their own food stall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ravi returns to the Square but gets a cold reception from Jack, while Junior and George try to support Kojo who is desperate to return to his flat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Okie threatens Kojo, demanding to know what he told the police, and when Honey picks up on Nicolas strange mood, she finally reveals whats going on

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: George and Junior struggle to remain civil over everything thats happened, and Amy is baffled to see Vicki defend and support Tommy when he is taunted by Denzel and Nugget

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tensions rise when Junior discovers George is planning to send Kojo back to Ghana, and Kat agrees to let Zoe get a security system for the Vic

programme.title: Last Christmas
programme.desc: Kate, an aspiring young singer who works a dead-end job as an elf at a Christmas shop in Central London, is made homeless after being evicted by her flatmate. Forced to live with her parents, she helps out at a homeless shelter and crosses paths with an enigmatic young man called Tom. However, their relationship proves far from straightforward. Director Paul Feigs romantic comedy, starring Emilia Clarke, Henry Golding, Michelle Yeoh and Emma Thompson, who also co-wrote the script

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The remaining queens give drag makeovers to celebrity guests Charlotte Church, Michelle McManus, Dani Harmer, Shobna Gulati, Diane Parish and David Potts. Sugababe Mutya Buena joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: My Mates a Bad Date
programme.desc: Relationship expert Oloni helps Cardiff-based 20-year-old hopeless romantic Lewis, who is scaring away potential partners by talking wedding plans on the first date

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: An Incan youngster suffers the worst birthday ever, a Roman farmer receives a visit from an unconventional salesman, and George IV embarks on a solo music career

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: Northern Ireland v Luxembourg (Kick-off 7.45pm). Stephen Watson presents all the action from both teams final FIFA World Cup Group A qualifier, held at Windsor Park. Goals by James Reid, Shea Charles and Justin Devenny gave Northern Ireland a 3-1 victory when the sides met at Stade de Luxembourg in the opening round of fixtures. Michael ONeills men will expect another win on home territory against a nation that lost their first four matches in the group, though the minnows have at least been competitive, with Germany the only team to overcome them by more than a two-goal margin

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: Eddie Hall: The Beast v the Mountain
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes access to Halls preparations for a Dubai bout with fellow former Worlds Strongest Man Hafthor Bjornsson, who gained fame as The Mountain in Game of Thrones. The pair were once close friends, but had a bitter falling out in 2017 and opted to settle their differences in the ring in what was dubbed as the heaviest boxing match in history. The documentary also looks at Eddies personal story, which has seen him struggle with mental health issues earlier in his life as he obsessively chased his goals

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons

programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when theyre worried. She and her owner, Katrina, visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Today Sylvie and Katrina are visiting a doctors surgery to help a little boy called Ben. Ben has fallen off his scooter and grazed his knee, and his mum says hes too nervous to come into the doctors room. Sylvies mission is to help Ben feel brave enough to see Dr Stevens. First, she gives Ben one of her biggest and best cuddles. Then, she and Dr Stevens show Ben how a doctor treats a patient. Sylvie loves performing in the starring role. Ben finally feels brave enough to go into the doctors room with his mum. But when Ben gets frightened and runs from the room, Sylvie must use all her superpowers to help him be braver still.

programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberrys in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay applies his gastronomic and business acumen to Simmer Down Cafe in Georgetown, Texas, whose owner Chris Marino wishes to attract a younger, richer clientele. Chris has asked his brother Albert to come out of retirement to help with the business, but struggles with the notion that things can function properly without his presence

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: No-naughty-bits version. As the closest-ever series of Taskmaster reaches its sparkling grand final, all five contestants are still in with a genuine chance of getting their hands on the revered trophy. In the mad dash to the finish line, Ania Magliano worries about leaving Phil Ellis unattended, Maisie Adam gets apple juice in her ear, Reece Shearsmith tries out a new nose and Sanjeev Bhaskar loses his temper over the word flanks. With mutiny in the air, Alex Horne gets drenched multiple times, before Greg Davies crowns the new champion

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable moments from recent episodes, featuring hosts Jimmy Carr, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Guest players include Jon Richardson, Nabil Abdulrashid, Maisie Adam, Tom Allen, Richard Ayoade, Lucy Beaumont, Kemah Bob, Alan Carr, Munya Chawawa, Roisin Conaty, Jack Dee, Dr Anne-Marie Imafidon, Rosie Jones, Russell Kane, Harriet Kemsley, Guz Khan, Judi Love, Lee Mack, Rose Matafeo, Sarah Millican, Jonathan Ross, Katherine Ryan, Laura Smyth, Phil Wang, David ODoherty, Mr Swallow and Joe Wilkinson

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Bobby Dazzler
programme.desc: A stand-up special in which the comedian explains the best way to eat a kiwi fruit, how a vagina candle should smell, trying to lose weight but only losing the tip of ones finger and the experience of undergoing a surprisingly funny smear test

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by singers Olly Murs and Kimberly Wyatt, and comedians Matthew Crosby and Russell Peters to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Extended edition of the ninth episode of the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys head to New Orleans, where they steal sips from strangers drinks at a famous bar, spin the Wheel of Voo-Doom on Bourbon Street, and crash some horse and buggy rides

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys head to the park and ask strangers to agree with their bizarre points of view, then give lessons about the property market

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys get extra cheesy at a pizza parlour, then head to Wall Street where they ask strangers to help translate bizarre text messages in Spanish

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Q, Sal and Murr take on more than they bargained for while working at a tailors shop, then convince strangers to hand over their mobile phones

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys work as receptionists in a waiting room, and try to mingle with the stiff crowd at a famous wax museum. This weeks punishment is a chopper ride from hell

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys work at Unique Copy Centre, give bizarre interviews with moviegoers, and stand up for ridiculous protests on the streets

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: With Adams graduation approaching, Beverly debates staying on as William Penn Academys Quaker Warden. Meanwhile, Erica tries to get out of the Schwartzs longstanding tradition of dinner together every Sunday and the subsequent household chores

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After a mould issue at home forces Erica and Geoff to stay at the Goldbergs, Beverly senses tensions in their marriage and seizes the opportunity to impart a little marital advice

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ted invites his old university professor, who told him he would never make it as an architect, to the grand opening of the GNB building. However, when the academic snubs him saying he does not know who he is, Ted goes back to the campus to confront him, taking the gang along for the ride. While there, Lily and Marshall run into an old acquaintance they would rather have avoided. Guest starring Seth Green and Peter Gallagher

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part two of two. Barney confides in Ted that he plans to propose to Patrice and swears him to secrecy, but Ted feels he should tell Robin what is happening, and asks her to be his date to the gala opening of the GNB building. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily enjoy their first night away together since the birth of Marvin and intend to savour every moment, but end up feeling anxious about their son

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy must decide whether or not to marry Sheldon and gives him an answer to his proposal. Howard and Bernadette struggle with some unexpected news. With guest stars Laurie Metcalf, Riki Lindhome and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard angers the university - and the entire physics community - when he gives an embarrassing interview. Amy and Bernadette bond over having to hide their success from Sheldon and Howard. Ira Flatow and Regina King guest star

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring singer Lek and footballer boyfriend Josh kick off the series of dinner parties in Aberdeen, aiming to impress their guests with an Asian/West Indian fusion menu. Day two sees Scottish couple Ange and Davie try to exceed expectations by serving up an Australian-themed night, but there are strong reactions to the kangaroo curry. One-time ravers Jason and Jennifer host the final evening, hoping their travel-inspired menu and surprising revelations will help them secure the cash prize

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Newlyweds Jen and Callum kick off the dinner party challenge in Aberdeen with an American-themed menu, while Debbie and her husband Shaun opt for Scottish-inspired dishes on the second night. Day three sees Sam and her boyfriend Jamie host, with each of the couples divulging their pet names for one another, before the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is revealed at the end of the night

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah and Masons, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentines Day - the busiest night of the year

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Ex water-skiing champion Hannah longs for a luxurious wedding day, but groom Tommy organises a ceremony at sea to celebrate his fiancees sporty past

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Dubliners Tracey and Peter have been together six years after meeting online. Tracey is the organiser, Peter is the complete opposite, a laidback scatterbrain whose only loves in life - apart from his bride-to-be - are their two-year-old son and football. Now he gets the chance to prove his worth, but it proves a rocky road to the big day, with advice from a naked stranger and a dodgy wedding veil before they get to the reception at - where else? - the sports club

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Roper, President and CEO of quick-service Tex-Mex restaurant chain Taco Bueno, disguises himself to work in secret among his own staff to gain more insight before growing the business. He works alongside general managers, a drive-through server and a supervisor at a tortilla-making plant

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah and Masons, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentines Day - the busiest night of the year

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. In order to save the struggling Italian restaurant from disaster, he must persuade harassed owner Julie to co-operate with the head chef, and work his magic on a menu that relies heavily on a microwave

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard plan respective birthday celebrations for Amy and Halley. A letter from his brother makes Leonard feel anxious about his own lack of accomplishments. The series takes a mid-season break until the new year.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon kicks Amy out of the apartment so that he can have some alone time to work, she and Leonard bond during a series of science experiments. Bert the geologist replaces Howard in his band Footprints on the Moon, and Sheldon finds Penny to be a surprising source of scientific inspiration. Laurie Metcalf and Brian Posehn guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj finds himself in the middle of a domestic drama when he realises that the woman hes dating, Nell, has a husband, Oliver, who is very upset about their new relationship. Sheldon rents his old room back to have a quiet place to work and drives Leonard crazy by being a model tenant

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Taskmaster

Task setter Alex Horne gets comfy by a campfire to hear Fatiha El-Ghorri tell a disturbing story about a goat, before hes compelled to join in with Mathew Bayntons ode to storage. As ever, Taskmaster Greg Davies determines the winners

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: While clearing up the loft, Dad finds his old, terrifying-looking ventriloquist dummy Lord Luck. Mum is horrified to see it again, but her spouse is in his element and cant stop playing with Lord Luck. Unfortunately Dad is a terrible ventriloquist, and it seems that Lord Luck only knows two words - ones not to be repeated in polite company. Meanwhile, Jonnys friend, Ben is coming for dinner. Hes recently been dumped by his fiancee and is in need of cheering up. Comedy, starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal and Tamsin Greig

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Adam brings his old violin back home, and as a special family treat Mum makes him agree to play the instrument for Grandma, who has been invited round for dinner. An amused Jonny relishes every moment of discomfort as he watches on from the sidelines. Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig, Paul Ritter and Frances Cuka star in Robert Poppers award-winning comedy

programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary following the lives of a wolf pack in North America, wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan and the team discover most of the animals have been killed by locals. However, as they try to find out whether any of the predators survived, there is a glimmer of hope on the horizon

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: Alan Rabinowitz, Gordon Buchanan, George McGavin, Steve Backshall and Justine Evans travel to the far-flung corners of the Himalayas in search of tigers, snow leopards and clouded leopards, on an expedition aimed at helping the survival of these creatures. The team gets to work by tracking elusive tigers and setting up remote-controlled cameras to film the animals in action

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: From the base camp in the Himalayas, the team moves out to track down tigers throughout Bhutan. Steve Backshall is pushed to the limits of his physical endurance when he takes on a white-water river in the eastern jungles, and Gordon Buchanan deploys remote cameras and uses a fingerprinting technique to identify individual cats. Meanwhile, biologist Dr George McGavin meets the predator during a trip to India

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The final leg of Michael Portillos journey begins in Edmonton, where he learns about the people who 300 years ago travelled huge distances by foot and canoe to trade with indigenous people. He also admires the citys early 20th-century streetcars, preserved by the Radial Railway Society, and its light rail system. Moving on, he views the Rocky Mountains, marvels at the scale of Canadas forestry industry and discovers how the beaver, once slaughtered for its fur, is now pampered

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britains finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nations best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigys science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia
programme.desc: An enigmatic British Army officer tries to unite the Arab nations against the Turks during the First World War, but comes into conflict with the military authorities when he engages the enemy with guerrilla tactics instead of more conventional methods. However, his increasingly torn loyalties leave him close to madness. Oscar-winning epic drama directed by David Lean, starring Peter OToole, Omar Sharif, Anthony Quinn, Alec Guinness and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriends father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: A soldier fighting in a post-apocalyptic war against living machines is sent back in time to prevent an attempt to change the past - but when he arrives, he finds that history has been changed beyond recognition - and that a plot is being hatched by an unexpected enemy to destroy the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke

programme.title: National Anthem
programme.desc: A construction worker in New Mexico joins a community of rodeo performers in search of their own version of the American dream. Drama, starring Charlie Plummer, Eve Lindley and Rene Rosado

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage to the future king of England falls for an aristocrat romantically linked to a possessive countess. Period drama, starring Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay and Flora Robson

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: Before going on to write classic fantasy books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, orphaned author JRR Tolkien finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school. Eventually his experiences during the First World War inspire him to create a world of hobbits and wizards. Biopic, starring Nicholas Hoult, Lily Collins, Pam Ferris, Craig Roberts, and Derek Jacobi

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Grays fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Vesper and her paralysed father struggle to survive on the desolate outskirts of a gated city, until they meet a mysterious woman who promises to change their lives. Sci-fi adventure, starring Raffiella Chapman, Eddie Marsan, Rosy McEwan and Richard Brake

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A rancher seizes the chance to settle his debts and earn his sons respect by agreeing to escort a notorious outlaw to the town of Contention, where a train will take the prisoner to jail. But the journey takes a dangerous turn when the criminal tries to manipulate the rancher into letting him go - while his henchmen lie in wait. Western remake, starring Russell Crowe, Christian Bale and Gretchen Mol

programme.title: Amanda
programme.desc: A young man takes on the responsibility of raising his seven-year-old niece Amanda, after his sister is killed in a terrorist attack on Paris. Mikhaël Herss drama, starring Vincent Lacoste and Isaure Multrier. In French

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Billy takes up boxing to pay for a saddle, and forms a friendship with his forthcoming opponent

programme.title: Hell in Normandy
programme.desc: A special parachute unit is sent to destroy a German flamethrower installation on Omaha Beach. Second World War drama, starring Guy Madison, Peter Lee Lawrence, Erika Blanc and Philippe Hersent

programme.title: The Kid from Texas
programme.desc: Billy the Kid tries to go straight, but is outlawed by double-crossing neighbours during the New Mexico land wars and destined for a showdown with lawman Pat Garrett. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Gale Storm and Albert Dekker

programme.title: Pony Express
programme.desc: Buffalo Bill Cody and Wild Bill Hickok work on establishing an east-west route for the pioneering mail service that will allow messages to be sent from Missouri to California in 10 days. However, they have to contend with saboteurs planning to prevent California becoming part of the Union. Western, starring Charlton Heston, Forrest Tucker, Rhonda Fleming and Jan Sterling

programme.title: Will Penny
programme.desc: An ageing cowboy takes a job on a ranch, driving off trespassers from the owners land. However, when he finds a woman and his son hiding out in a cabin, he takes pity on them and allows them to stay. But as an attraction develops between them, a bandit the cowboy had crossed in the past comes looking for him. Western, starring Charlton Heston, Joan Hackett and Donald Pleasence

Meanwhile, Rose meets a dashing stranger, Branson makes up his mind about Sarah Bunting and Anna is disturbed by a visit from Inspector Vyner

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Following the altercation, relations between Robert and Cora are strained, while Blakes scheming starts to come to fruition when Mary is unexpectedly pitted against her love rival. Edith decides to take drastic measures after receiving terrible news, leaving various parties reeling. Baxter is embroiled in the investigation into Greens death following a mysterious tip-off, and as Thomass health deteriorates, he finally reveals the truth to the maid. Elsewhere, love is in the air for more than one member of the Crawley family. Guest starring Sue Johnston (The Royle Family, Coronation Street)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeants exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. The victim had been at odds with his peers over the fate of a potentially lucrative parcel of college-owned land, and the case is complicated by the appearance of DI Thursdays old gangland enemy - whom he must face alone while Endeavour makes a trip back to Lincolnshire to visit his ailing father

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is discovered bound to a tree, doused in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads DCI Barnaby to tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron at the upmarket Wyvern House restaurant. However, secrets from the past surface after the murderer strikes again, and the repercussions are felt further than they were originally intended. With Neil Dudgeon, Neil McCaul, Sharon Small, Marc Elliott and Arabella Weir

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Denniss two families in order to find the truth about his death

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: DS Sarah Collins is called to the brutal stabbing of a teenager, but her investigation soon finds itself at cross purposes with a covert operation led by Kieran Shaw, who is working with Sarahs old partner Steve Bradshaw, now deep undercover. Meanwhile, Lizzie Adama is back at Farlow trying to balance her new role as a detective with family life, but her path and Kierans are about to cross. Crime thriller, starring Gemma Whelan

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: Sarah and Elaine are called to a brutal hit-and-run, uncovering a disturbing link to their ongoing investigation. Kieran urges Lizzie not to reveal the secrets of Operation Perseus

programme.desc: Jack and Blakey turn out to be the only entrants in a gardening competition organised by the depot managers wife. Seventies comedy, starring Bob Grant

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew becomes convinced he is being framed for Rosemarys disappearance. Emily holds leaving drinks at the Woolpack and Gray begs Jonny not to reveal his sexuality to Katie.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Secrets could be exposed as Rosamund arrives at Downton following Ediths shock departure. Rose is delighted to introduce Atticus and his parents to the Abbey, while Anna and Bates start thinking about a fresh start, now that the worst of their problems are seemingly behind them. Molesley is concerned to see Daisy becoming disillusioned with her studies, and Isobel makes a happy announcement, but there may be trouble on the horizon. Violet has her hands full with her warring servants, while Mary and Blake seize an opportunity to send Gillingham a strong message

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic, with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village, where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An informant reveals two local hoodlums are planning to raid a shipment of gold bullion from Haworth Point, prompting Shiner to set up an ambush to catch the would-be thieves. Gina receives a visit from her niece, who has fallen in with a bad crowd back in Manchester, while Liz enlists David to paint the surgery and sitting room - but is less than pleased with the results. Drama, starring Simon Molloy and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A clairvoyant at Whitby Funfair gives a bride-to-be cold feet about her imminent nuptials. Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough

Charlotte Crosby was one of the breakout stars of the inaugural series and she headlines this four-part unscripted spin-off. As the title intimates, Geordie Stories: Charlottes New Baby follows the star and her partner Jake Ankers as they prepare to welcome a brother or sister into the world for Jakes daughter Alba. The birth coincides with Charlotte landing a role on the international edition Aussie Shore

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourts portable record player from the 1950s. programme.desc: Documentary exploring the making of John Lennons first solo album John Lennon/Plastic Ono Band, which includes Mother, Love and Working Class Hero. The programme uncovers how themes of isolation, anger, religion and class were drawn from his own experiences, with most tracks written while he was undergoing therapy with Dr Arthur Janov in California. Featuring contributions by Yoko Ono, Ringo Starr, Klaus Voorman and Jan Wenner
