A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster epic, starring John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: Dual
programme.desc: A woman named Sarah opts for a cloning procedure after she receives a terminal diagnosis. She unexpectedly recovers, but her attempts to have the clone decommissioned fail, leading to a court-mandated battle to the death. Sci-fi thriller, starring Karen Gillan and Aaron Paul

programme.title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice roams the post-apocalyptic wasteland searching for human survivors. An encounter with an old friend leads her to a rumoured sanctuary in Los Angeles, but she discovers she has walked into a deadly trap and must once again battle the hordes of the living dead. Action horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich, Ali Larter and Wentworth Miller

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischers comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husbands murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Strange Darling
programme.desc: A twisted one-night stand devolves into a serial killers vicious killing spree and a cat-and-mouse chase. Writer/director JT Mollners thriller, starring Willa Fitzgerald, Kyle Gallner, Madisen Beaty and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: Heart Eyes
programme.desc: When two co-workers survive a killer on Valentines Day, the two have to find out who it is. Comedy horror, starring Mason Gooding, Olivia Holt and Gigi Zumbado

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt

programme.title: The Bikeriders
programme.desc: Truck driver Johnny is inspired to establish the Vandals motorcycle club in 1960s Chicago. He assembles a motley crew, including Brucie, Benny, Cal and Zipco. Exuberant outsider Kathy falls under Bennys spell, and they marry, but when the groom is the victim of a violent assault, Johnny exacts revenge, while Kathy fights for her husbands tormented soul. Drama, starring Tom Hardy, Jodie Comer and Austin Butler

programme.title: Oceans Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean rounds up his band of crooks for one last heist. Gang member Reuben has been left traumatised and in a coma after being double-crossed by crooked casino owner Willy Bank, and Danny decides that payback is in order. He plans a scheme that will leave Bank penniless, but needs the help of an old enemy. Comedy crime caper sequel, with George Clooney, Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia, Don Cheadle and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancys novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: Speak No Evil
programme.desc: On holiday in Europe, American couple Ben and Louise Dalton and their anxiety-crippled daughter Agnes meet English doctor Patrick Feld, his wife Ciara and their young son Ant, who was born without a tongue. The Daltons vacation soon turns into a nightmare when they are invited to stay on the Felds country estate. Horror, starring James McAvoy, Mackenzie Davis, Scoot McNairy and Aisling Franciosi

programme.title: Oceans 8
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of brother Danny, light-fingered Debbie Ocean plans to steal the Toussaint, a $150million necklace from Vogues Met Gala, with the help of a famous actress. Crime caper, starring Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Four teenagers are sentenced to reform school after a prank results in the accidental death of an old man, and suffer sexual abuse at the hands of the guards. Years later, when the boys have grown up and begun to follow very different professions, a chance encounter with one of their abusers inspires them to plot revenge. Drama, starring Brad Pitt, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman, Kevin Bacon, Jason Patric and Minnie Driver

programme.title: Force of Nature: The Dry 2
programme.desc: Five women participate in a hiking retreat, but only four come out the other side. Federal agents Aaron Falk and Carmen Cooper head into the mountains hoping to find their informant still alive. Thriller, starring Eric Bana, Anna Torv and Deborra-Lee Furness

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Nov 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote dAzur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcocks romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis

programme.title: Sharp Corner
programme.desc: Josh McCall is a family man who becomes obsessed with saving the lives of the car accident victims on the sharp corner in front of his house. Its an obsession that could cost him everything. Writer/director Jason Buxtons thriller, starring Ben Foster, Cobie Smulders and Gavin Drea

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger

Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: Black Bag
programme.desc: When a spy is suspected of treason, her husband faces the ultimate test - loyalty to his marriage or his country. Director Steven Soderberghs thriller, starring Michael Fassbender, Cate Blanchett and Rege-Jean Page

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollacks thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his bosss wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantinos crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: International thief Simon Templar, a cunning master of disguise with a Swiss bank account almost full enough to retire on, accepts one last job - to steal a female scientists formula for cold fusion. However, he breaks his own golden rule by getting emotionally involved with the woman, leading to a deadly chase as the pair meet up in Russia and try to flee from the real bad guys. Action adventure, starring Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue and Henry Goodman

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene mulls over a life-changing offer, Jackie heads to the bottom of the bottle and Beckys hopes of a happily ever after are jeopardised

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie steps into the role of paternal figure in the wake of Emilios deportation, while Darlene becomes entangled in a complex love triangle

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Andre and Spencers rivalry reaches a new level when Andre makes a visit to the office. Meanwhile, Charles tries to keep Ricky in Miami. Comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Spencer is forced to ask for help during his draft day party, while keeping some of ASMs latest developments on the down low. Comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Leo invites his trendy ex-girlfriend to a dinner party. Grace asks Will, Jack and Karen to come along and keep the night running smoothly, but the guest of honour turns out to be the only girl Will ever slept with. Meanwhile, Lorraines dog is discovered hiding in Stans closet. Guest starring Mira Sorvino

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Karen demonstrates fearsome ball skills at her exclusive tennis club when Grace invites Leo to join the game, without asking her friends permission first. Will ropes Jack into accompanying him on a visit to his depressed mother. Megan Mullally and Harry Connick Jr star

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Jack lands a small part in a Broadway play and makes such a good impression he steals the limelight from the star - renowned actor James Earl Jones, who ends up seeking extra acting tuition from the man himself. Meanwhile, Will and his mother struggle with their living arrangements

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Wills attempt to help Leo enjoy the finer points of New York has unexpected consequences, while Jack takes part in a spelling contest with help from his coach Karen. Guest starring Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Will meets an attractive bachelor when he takes his mother out for the day, but struggles to pluck up the courage to ask the stranger out on a date. Karen tracks Lorraine down to the Peninsula hotel - but is shocked to learn who is sharing her room. John Cleese guest stars

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie is consumed by guilt over her affair with Big, and wonders whether Aidan will ever be able to forgive her. Charlotte stuns the others by announcing she wants to leave her job and have a baby, and Samanthas new man puts a damper on their sex life by telling her to get a bikini wax. Starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall and Kristin Davis

programme.title: Sex and the City

programme.desc: For decades five families - Genovese, Gambino, Bonnano, Colombo and Lucchese - ruled New York and built an underworld empire. programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: In a world without humans, the deserts once tamed rise to reclaim great triumphs - from Las Vegas to Dubais Burj Khalifa. As sand, salt and sun gradually dismantled cities, the wastelands would quietly take back the ground borrowed

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The suggestion that mythological tales of Norse deities, such as Odin and Thor, were inspired by real encounters with extraterrestrial beings

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The team follows the search for artefacts from the Second World War, joining marine archaeologists in the Solent as they raise a Fairey Barracuda divebomber. Elsewhere, a dig in the Lake District tells the moving story of the Windermere Boys, and in Aldbourne in Wiltshire, archaeologists search for personal items from the most famous American unit of the US army, Easy Company, who were stationed there in 1943 and 1944

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Centuries ago, canals were the liquid highways of Britain, transporting raw materials and finished goods all over the country. Their arrival kick-started the Industrial Revolution, which was to turn Britain into a superpower. The very first water superhighway was the Bridgewater Canal, completed in 1761 to carry coal to Manchester from the mines in Worsley. Here, a team of archaeologists from Salford University roots out this industrial past, working with volunteers to excavate the very coal mine that inspired the creation of the canal

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Raksha Dave and Alex Langlands search for the remains of a First World War stable at Catterick Garrison in North Yorkshire, where thousands of horses would have been housed and trained for the front line. They join a team comprised of archaeologists and the military attempting to uncover the role this building played in the war effort. They also visit Britains oldest cavalry regiment, examining tools that soldiers would have used to look after their steeds, and hear the story of Warrior, known as the horse the Germans could not kill

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of York Castle, built on the orders of William the Conqueror and once the regional seat of British government. The castle has also been used as a prison and a royal mint, and in 1308, 25 Knights Templar were jailed there and examined on charges of heresy, idolatry and other crimes. The castle was also where Dick Turpin was held prior to his execution in 1739 and Dan tries to separate fact from fiction regarding the many myths to have developed about the infamous highwayman

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the 900-year history of Leeds Castle in Kent, from its origins as a royal Saxon familys manor and Norman stronghold to the private property of six medieval queens, a Tudor palace, a Jacobean country house and a Georgian mansion. Its last owner, Lady Olive Baillie, made it a centre of lavish hospitality for leading politicians, international royalty and film stars. When she died in 1974, she bequeathed the castle and grounds to a specially created charitable trust so that future generations could enjoy her home

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Lancaster Castle has witnessed scenes of historical, cultural and political significance throughout the centuries, including incidents of religious persecution, the trials of the Lancashire Witches and 200 public executions. Owned by the Duchy of Lancaster, it was a state prison until 2011 and is still a working crown court. Dan Jones explores its turbulent history and meets Wendy Robinson, a retired prosecutor from Australia, whose ancestors were sentenced to death at Lancaster Crown Court in 1817 for stealing sheep

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Arundel Castle, in West Sussex, has been the seat of the Dukes of Norfolk and their ancestors for over 850 years, with its fortunes rising and falling with those of the Howard family. A particularly low point occured when Thomas Howard, the fourth Duke of Norfolk, was executed by Elizabeth I for allegedly plotting to marry her rival Mary Queen of Scots. Dan Jones meets a weapons expert, who shows him how Richard FitzAlan, the third Earl of Arundel, would have fought in the 100 Years War. He also meets a social historian, who gives an insight into how Arundel would have prepared for Queen Victorias visit in 1846

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids

programme.title: After the Wildfires
programme.desc: In 2020, Australia went up in flames. The scale and intensity signified an undeniable new phase in the global climate crisis. For Australias wildlife, who have adapted to severities of weather, it was cataclysmic. And for those who did survive, the real challenge only now begins. This documentary examines the toll, the recovery and the healing of the wild after Australias wildfires

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.sub-title: Retro Efl Cup Final 2009: Manchester United V Tottenham
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate

programme.desc: The Butterfield Bermuda Championship. Coverage of day four of the tournament, held at the Port Royal Golf Course in Southampton, Bermuda. programme.title: Live Grand Slam of Darts
programme.sub-title: Grand Slam Of Darts S/Finals 16.11 Wolverhampton
programme.desc: Coverage of the semi-finals on day nine from WV Active Aldersley in Wolverhampton, which are staged over the best of 31 legs. Martin Lukeman booked his place in last years final with a 16-12 victory over Mickey Mansell at this stage, and he would go on to face Luke Littler after he overcame Gary Anderson 16-15 in the other last-four match, with both players recording a three-dart average in excess of 100

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Finals singles final. Coverage of the showpiece match on day eight of the year-end event, which takes place at Inalpi Arena in Turin, Italy. The number one seed at the 2024 tournament, Jannik Sinner, was crowned champion following a 6-4, 6-4 triumph over the fifth seed Taylor Fritz, becoming the first Italian to win this event, and the first to do so without dropping a set since Ivan Lendl in 1986

programme.title: Live Grand Slam of Darts
programme.sub-title: Grand Slam Of Darts Final 16.11 Wolverhampton
programme.desc: Coverage of the final on day nine from WV Active Aldersley in Wolverhampton, which is staged over the best of 31 legs. After a gruelling semi-final, Luke Littler showcased some of his best form as he cantered to a 16-3 victory over Martin Lukeman to be crowned champion at last years event, producing a tournament-high three-dart average of 107 in the process

programme.title: Croíthe Radacacha
programme.desc: Director Ciara Hyland explores the hidden stories of eight female couples at the heart of the Irish Revolution that freed Ireland from the British Empire. These women were extraordinary in the lives they lived - they were radical in their politics, in their feminism, their socialism and their devotion to freedom and equality

programme.title: Ar Iarraidh
programme.desc: In February 2011, a week before her 39th birthday, Esra Uyrun went to her local shop to buy a pint of milk. The mother-of-one left her home in Clondalkin, Dublin, and was never seen again. Esras sister Berna and friend Ilknur, travel to Ireland from the UK several times a year, dedicating every minute spent in Ireland to finding answers in the hope someone will come forward with new information. This programme offers an insight into the relentless appeal for information and the heartbreak that the families of missing persons endure

programme.title: James Mays Things You Need to Know
programme.desc: The Top Gear presenter explores the complex world of the human brain, discovering why men tend to avoid asking for directions and what love has in common with Class A drugs. He also uses animations and computer graphics to delve into the science behind the human memory

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate Britains love of seafood and the plentiful and diverse supply of produce obtained from local waters. They also explore the history of Billingsgate Market in east London, the countrys largest inland fish market

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer and Paul Whitehouse fish for wild carp in Mid Wales, spending their first day at an ancient glacial lake where Bob tries out new gear he is keen to use and hopes will make a difference to his fishing. During this trip, Bob and Paul meet Mick May and Marina Gibson, who together have started a charity called Cancer and Pisces, which offers fishing as therapeutic respite for people with cancer

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob are on the River Severn in Worcestershire to fish for zander, and enlist the help of local guide Tim Maslen to find the best spots. As they sit and wait, they ruminate on the state of Britains rivers in general, the threats that they are under and what it takes to do something to help them improve. After a few hours they move down the river to a secluded beach and meet their special guest - local actor and self-confessed fishing addict Charlie Cooper, star of This Country

programme.title: Guy Martins Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europes biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britains most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness travel to Ethiopia, where they test cars to see how they can endure in the searing heat. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness present an electric cars special, each taking up the challenge of constructing a battery-powered sports car on a budget. Plus, Chris takes the Tesla Model 3 for a spin on the test track. Plus, Danny Boyle and Himesh Patel, director and star of fantasy comedy Yesterday, drop into the studio

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wifes advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and Johns day in Glasgow gets off to a flying start, but Dans dirty tactics lead to mayhem within the team. Meanwhile, George finds himself with a new pet

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The bidders head to Preston, where Dans arrogant behaviour gets him into trouble once again. Presented by Sean Kelly

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate Britains love of seafood and the plentiful and diverse supply of produce obtained from local waters. They also explore the history of Billingsgate Market in east London, the countrys largest inland fish market

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: Simon starts his travels through Brazil in one of the remotest regions of the Amazon with the Waiapi people, who cling on to their traditional way of life, which is under threat from logging and mining interests. In Manaus, the city at the heart of the Amazon, he visits a neglected indigenous neighbourhood and meets a nurse who was the only source of healthcare during the pandemic. Simon ends this leg of his journey on the west coast in the city of Rio de Janeiro, where the government has built a hi-tech control room to monitor all parts of the city for potential disasters such as floods

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: In the third part of his journey, Simon travels through the Andes mountains from Peru to Bolivia, beginning at the world-famous ruins of Machu Pichu. He then visits a remote valley where the mostly indigenous population farms coca leaves. the primary ingredient of cocaine. Heading across the border into Bolivia, Simon discovers how the indigenous women known as cholas have battled for increasing influence and representation

programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Jeremy puts the 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, and actress Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the Jaguar F-type R and Eagles modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers revisit the 1970s, a decade which is all too often unfairly stigmatised for its food. They show how a well-prepared chicken cordon bleu and banoffee pie can be a contemporary gastronomic delight, before heading to a restaurant whose menu harks back to that era

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the worlds busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the countys china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwalls highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwalls picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Lands End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

Police drama, with Andrew Paul and George Rossi

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A businessmans daughter is kidnapped by Chinese gangsters operating a safe house for illegal immigrants. programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. programme.desc: Celia reacts badly to Johns revelation that Caroline is gay and makes no attempt to accept her daughters new partner, leading to a bitter argument. programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel treats a seven-month-old fox red Labrador puppy with lameness, caused by a joint defect called osteochondritis dissecans. He explains that medicine can be given, but in the end the dog may end up requiring a complete ankle replacement or a joint fusion on both sides. Jo has travelled 400 miles to bring her beloved four-year-old springer spaniel to see Noel. The poochs kneecap keeps slipping in and out of her knee joint, and despite several previous procedures, the problems persist. After an examination by Noel, Jo faces the further worry of osteoarthritis

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Catherine and Simon went through years of fertility treatment to have their first son, which took a toll on their love life, but five years later, awaiting an elective C-section for their second baby, its a different story - a spontaneous romantic evening resulted in an unexpected positive pregnancy test. Heather ran into complications during her first pregnancy and had to deliver twins at 24 weeks. They pulled through, but cerebral palsy and other issues have meant she is now a full-time carer to them both. She also has Alfie, and after he was born, she and partner Dan decided they would have a fourth child to give him a companion to help share the responsibility of siblings with a disability. Christian couple Naomi and Dan tied the knot young and had their first child 13 months ago. Now, theyre back at Southmead for baby number two

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Since Martyn met Jade, he hasnt had a permanent place to live and has been spending every night on a different friends sofa. A disagreement with his stepfather caused a rift between them, so he has always wanted to create a strong loving family of his own. With Jade by his side he cannot wait to get started. Kerri is expecting her third child and is keen to follow in her mothers footsteps by having a home birth, while Claire and Nigel have their hands full with five children, and Claire has decided that baby number six will definitely be the last one

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Scunthorpe woman Caroline Blanchard, a single mum who has twice had to make the decision to turn off the life support for people she loves. She and her children live in the shadow of the garage, where seven-year-old Natasha banged her head in 2007, and the conservatory, where husband and father Paul had a heart attack four years later. The volunteers plan is to give them a new home for a new start, including demolishing the conservatory and garage where these two tragedies occurred

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mums untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The Top 10 duos, in a pier-side setting, are tasked with feeding over 100 local fishermen and women - the worst performing team faces the Pressure Test

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Its Petes first day at Dogs Trust, and he meets a pug facing a worrying surgery and pregnant dog who was seized at the border

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Spaniel Scrumpy is suffering from lameness and Noel discovers he has a collapsed disc and severe elbow arthritis. He already has a chequered medical history totalling six previous operations to his elbows, hip and knee. Meanwhile, there is an emergency admission when a 15-month-old dachshund arrives with a mystery brain condition, and Noel and his neurology colleagues have their work cut out to identify the cause. When his condition rapidly deteriorates overnight, suddenly the life of this much-loved young dog hangs in the balance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Four-year-old pug and beagle cross Barney is brought into Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a bus. The dog has lost 40 per cent of the bone in the damaged leg, so Noel creates an innovative two-tier treatment, involving an external ankle frame for support. Sisters Rosemary and Diane bring in their five-year-old basset hound Albert when they find he is suddenly unable to move his back legs, and 10-month-old Labrador cross Gylly receives treatment for lameness and an unusual bone deformity

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Emma grew up living with who she thought were her mother, father and sisters, until her mum was diagnosed with cancer and her family decided it was time to tell her the truth. She discovered one of her sisters was really her biological mother. With a baby on the way and boyfriend Ben by her side, the 17-year-old is determined to take a different path and declare no more family secrets. Bethany and Dan reflect on an emotional four years of trying to have a child, while pregnant Rachel talks about how she may have to change religion and move away from home to be with her partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah and Jonathan met at junior school as eight-year-olds and were best friends for years until they eventually got together. Now theyre in Southmead expecting their second baby, but the mother-to-be is getting increasingly anxious and the memory of her difficult first labour begins to induce a panic attack. Meanwhile, Vikki and Jack are having their first child and are keen for a big family after going through lonely and troubled upbringings themselves, while Naomi has to spend the night in hospital away from her partner Chris as she waits for labour to kick in

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: The finalists level up childhood favourites and cater for a celebrity party attended by Michael Dapaah and AJ Tracey, with the help of the eliminated cooks

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Saffys pregnancy sends her mum off the deep end, bringing nightmares about becoming a grandmother, her torture compounded by the taunting midwife. Luckily, Eddies new celebrity book club started with Patsy takes her mind off her troubles, as Mariella Frostrup promises to bring her famous friends

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the Riviera of the Highlands. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michaels next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his railway journey from Newcastle to Loch Ness, steered by his 1930s Bradshaws Guide. Stopping at Dundee, Michael heads for Glamis Castle, where Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon, the Queen Mother, grew up. Michael hears about her happy childhood and how she later found sanctuary there, when King Edward VIII abdicated and she and Prince Albert unexpectedly became king and queen of the United Kingdom

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog Major head to Angus and the town of Arbroath, a fine red sandstone town which nestles around its historic abbey. No longer with a fishing industry, the town relies on leisure boats visiting the beautiful little harbour, and Ian and Major have the chance to make pizza, bottle some rum and ride the dodgems

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian and Major head to the capital of the Western Isles and finds Stornoway is looking to the future with plans for a big new harbour to attract cruise ships and more business investment

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: A skipper collapses in the wheelhouse but insists on continuing fishing, and a storm threatens a crew still mourning the loss of a shipmate at sea

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: The trawlers Fruitful Bough and Rosebloom, crewed by two sets of brothers, find themselves not only working for each other, but also competing for catches. One trawler has its net completely ripped away by a massive swell, but it is also richly rewarded by huge hauls of prawns

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek Mathewson picks up a lovingly restored 1925 Calthorpe motorbike that he thinks is more of a work of art than anything ever produced by Picasso

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave Mathewson gets wind of a possible free lunch at the officers mess when he heads off to collect a stylish Swedish Volvo P1800S from an RAF base in the Midlands

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team, including Andy Joynson, buy the right kind of Land Rover, but its got the wrong engine. Can they clean up its emissions with a modern motor?

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will want to buy an MGB roadster but the cheaper GT version is the one they find. Its got a few rust patches, and back in the workshop they realise beauty is skin deep

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the regions few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascars unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: In the third part of his journey, Simon travels through the Andes mountains from Peru to Bolivia, beginning at the world-famous ruins of Machu Pichu. He then visits a remote valley where the mostly indigenous population farms coca leaves. the primary ingredient of cocaine. Heading across the border into Bolivia, Simon discovers how the indigenous women known as cholas have battled for increasing influence and representation

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: The actor walks along the north coast of Normandy, France, tracing the footsteps of the soldiers who took part in the D-Day landings

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will want to buy an MGB roadster but the cheaper GT version is the one they find. Its got a few rust patches, and back in the workshop they realise beauty is skin deep

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team, including Andy Joynson, buy the right kind of Land Rover, but its got the wrong engine. Can they clean up its emissions with a modern motor?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek Mathewson collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.sub-title: Red E Type and Fast Fords
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Daves pulse racing

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husbands treasured collection of Rolls-Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is at Elgins port, the coastal town of Lossiemouth, where the Labour Partys first prime minister James Ramsay MacDonald was born. Nearby, Michael finds a remote boarding school established in the 1930s and famous today both for its unusual ideas and its royal former pupils. His penultimate stop is Inverness, where he uncovers the work of female photographer MEM Donaldson, who documented a Highland way of life that was rapidly disappearing. Michaels journey ends at Loch Ness, where he joins a Deep Scan research team scouring the deep for signs of the elusive monster

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day. He visits Britains first studio pottery, where he attempts a decorative wax technique and feels the heat of the firing kiln. Michael also joins a family on holiday in a railway carriage called Harvey

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Cornwalls county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by professional plant hunters commissioned by its owner. The Atlantic Coast branch line carries Michael north to Newquay, where he discovers a pioneering surfer and braves the waves on a belly board. In the nearby village of St Mawgan, Michael is introduced to the ancient Cornish sport of wrassling, which surged in popularity between the wars as part of a Cornish Celtic revival

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain. Out on the rugged moor, Michael hears how the celebrated author Daphne du Maurier captivated readers between the wars with her tales of smuggling at the Jamaica Inn. In Devon, Michael takes the plunge at Plymouths beautiful art deco Tinside Lido, while at Ivybridge, he boards a vehicle like no other to cross the causeway to Burgh Island, where a 1930s playboy built a splendid art deco party palace

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Scotland in the mother of all rainstorms to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible. Plus, Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Theres a surprise for Derek in Hull - an MGSA sports car that once had a tree growing through it. Plus, in North Wales, Alan Holmes is selling his sons Ford Escort RS 1600i

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germanys plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents expert assessments of items not initially shown in programmes from visits to Abbotsford and Burghley. Treasures include a jewel box made for a princess but never given to her, a Chinese watercolour with a staggering valuation, and the oldest walking stick ever brought to a Roadshow

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Chester Cathedral, where objects under scrutiny include a sheriffs ring of office, a collection of hand-carved wooden shoes and a painting that has been left lying under a bed for many years

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts return to the British Museum in London, where items brought in by members of the public include photos of a young Elvis Presley, a collection of objects found by mudlarkers on the banks of the Thames and a pot that is not as ancient as it seems

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxtons famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming explores the English canal network, beginning with a journey from Shardlow to Etruria Junction, Stoke on Trent, exploring the Trent and Mersey Canal. However, not everything goes to plan, and he will have to deal with a tricky issue with his propeller as well as navigating the complicated locks on the Trent and Mersey Canal

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: The presenter hikes the Great Glen Way in Scotland, a rift valley that cuts through the Highlands from the foot of Ben Nevis to Loch Ness

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simons journey begins at the Giants Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwells influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.desc: Exploring the Tunisian desert and a vast chain of ruins that once stood in the way of Allied Victory - until a band of rogue heroes uncovered their weakness

programme.title: Ainsleys Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriot celebrates food that gives people a boost, focusing on dishes that include fruits and berries, including rose harissa chicken tagine with apricots and chickpeas. Joseph Denison Carey pays a visit to Jade at Bitesize Bakehouse, whose handmade marshmallows are packed full of fruit for a masterclass in how to make the pillowy treats

programme.desc: The chef meets a family who live off grid, samples fabada stew, Urbies cheese, and visits a restaurant famous for its sardines

programme.desc: Alan is joined by Queen guitarist Brian May, cricket pundit Phil Tufnell and actress Denise Black, while Camilla Bassett-Smith shows how to heat up greenhouses in winter. programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: Albania v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams final FIFA World Cup Group K match, held at Arena Kombëtare in Tirana. England opened their campaign with a 2-0 win when the teams met at Wembley in March, with Myles Lewis-Skelly and Harry Kane the scorers. Thomas Tuchels men went on to secure qualification with two matches to spare, meaning the pressure is off for them this evening, while Albania are battling it out with Serbia for second place in the group and a spot in the play-offs. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, reports from Gabriel Clarke and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsys Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Sport Stories: Philly McMahon
programme.desc: The eight-time All-Ireland-winner talks about his journey of self-sacrifice, sense of identity, personal tragedy and an insatiable desire for success

Her brother and his partner are fresh from playing a round of golf - and making friends with a millionaire into the bargain. During the day, Cathy sees a new side to Kelly, whose mother appears to take custody of an old fridge. Michael is assisting too - and also faces a decision. Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan and Lisa McGrillis star in the subtle family comedy from Bafta award-winning writer of Him and Her, Stefan Golaszewski

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: August sees a hot summers day, and while Kelly and her cousin sunbathe in the garden, Cathy is getting ready to go for a lunch appointment with a new - male - friend. Michael is taking her and seems particularly keen to find out more about the person she is to meet. Subtle family comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Liz Merrick faces a trying time when one of her patients misses an appointment to discuss medication, and subsequently ends up charged with drink-driving, while Vernons pal David is kidnapped and held to ransom. Merton is delighted Jenny has agreed to marry him, and Bellamy finds out that Gina is carrying his baby. Rural drama, starring Aislin McGuckin, Geoffrey Hughes and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: Senior keeper James Andrewes offers a glimpse inside the largest free-flying bat cave in Europe - the Twilight Zone at Chester Zoo, which is home to a variety of species

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: Part one of two. Cassie and Sam are together at Sams new Lake House when an unexpected turn of events gives both of them plenty of food for thought

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King travel the country on a mission to bring together the best local restaurants with the most innovative local suppliers. Each week, the duo base themselves in one stunning region, meeting with local chefs in the hopes of inspiring them to find new ingredients from producers that they can showcase on their menus. In the first episode, Dave and Si head to Penarth, South Wales, where they meet a father and daughter team at their restaurant, Home, before heading out to find potential new suppliers that can offer the pair ingredients of the highest quality for their eight-course tasting menu

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi sets out to boost the fortunes of the Crown Inn in Lewes, East Sussex. As well as being stripped of one of its three stars by the tourist board, the hotel has received a succession of scathing internet reviews, and owner Karen Lloyd has lost more than £32,000. After spending a night in the establishment, Alex sends in the deep cleaners, renovates the bedrooms and reorganises the staff in a bid to transform the hotels reputation

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former Britains Got Talent stars Demi and Lagi Demetrio, better known as dancing duo Stavros Flatley, step into the role of mystery hosts for weeks last dinner party. The pair tease their hapless diners with a series of clues as to their identity, and play up to their image by preparing a selection of Greek-themed dishes. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Animal Emergency
programme.desc: A French bulldog arrives at the vets for specialist spinal surgery to help him walk properly. Staff in the large animal department have to decide if a wild seals eye is able to be saved, and nurse Clodagh and vet Myles have to look long and hard to find a magnet in a parrots gizzard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Intrigue spreads among the residents of Aidensfield as Frances Elliot causes havoc with her car. An outraged Peggy decides to investigate the rumours about the newcomer and discovers she appears to be hiding something. Rob receives some good news in the post but is later forced into making a life-changing decision. Kerrie Taylor guests

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part One
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kev is sent spiralling, Paddy is troubled and Eve thinks she has spotted her grandfather

programme.desc: Will returns home with something to get off his chest, Kevin refuses to help Tyrone at the garage, Brodys mis-timed outburst jeopardises Joanies homecoming, and Gary seeks Todds blessing for Theo to work with Pete again

programme.sub-title: Cometh the Hour, Cometh the Man

Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanah, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: When a housewife is found hanged in her home, the police initially mark it down as suicide. However, a meeting with an Oxford law professor prompts a sceptical Lewis and Hathaway to believe something more sinister is afoot - a suspicion confirmed by the death of another woman. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A prisoner is broken out of Ashfordly prison to pilot a helicopter on a secret mission, and Debbie begins acting strangely when a familiar face returns to the village. Meanwhile, Rob is left distraught when a boy takes revenge for the death of his dog

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: News of Ross and Demelzas marriage shocks the locals, although Charless reaction to the union is the most unexpected of all as his amusement at the situation brings on another heart attack. Verity befriends her cousins new bride and sets about teaching her the art of being a lady - something that will come in handy when the couple are invited to spend Christmas with the Trenwith Poldarks. Demelza is introduced to the fearsome Aunt Agatha, a woman known to never mince her words

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Theo puts the final nail into the coffin of Todds career, Kit moves in with Sarah, Tim despairs when Sally confronts Trisha with her suspicions, and Carl jumps at the chance to offload Alfie

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Theo puts the final nail into the coffin of Todds career, Kit moves in with Sarah, Tim despairs when Sally confronts Trisha with her suspicions, and Carl jumps at the chance to offload Alfie

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: April makes a difficult phone call from the police interview room as she tells someone she needs help, while Kammy plans a housewarming party and Robert is feeling guilty

programme.title: Rig 45
programme.desc: A damage regulator is sent to investigate an accident on an oil rig two days before Christmas, but just as the crew realise it was a murder, the rig is cut off from the mainland by a hurricane, while the murderer is still among everyone on board. Drama, starring Catherine Walker

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy is trying to get ready for work on an early October morning, while Jason has an interview for a job in Australia and Kelly is upset she might have to move there. After a heavy night out with Derek, Michael finds himself on Cathys sofa with a secret to keep from her

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: The year has almost turned full circle since the death of her other half, and as Cathy finalises preparations for a New Years Eve party, Kelly and Jason arrive back arguing. Michael turns up, and as Cathy attempts to sort out Jason and keep festivities moving, she also tries to find the right moment to give him his Christmas present. Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan star in the subtle family comedy in which a woman makes plans to move on from the death of her husband and find love second time around

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Miami Dolphins v Washington Commanders (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the week 11 match at the Bernabeu in Madrid. The Dolphins claimed an emphatic 45-15 away win when the teams last met in December 2023, but like their opponents, they have struggled for form so far this season

programme.title: Britains Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Top scorers the Wrights and the Pasquales go head to head in the hope of being crowned Britains Brightest Celebrity Family, fighting it out in the final to win £25,000 for their charity. Anne Hegerty hosts

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, Ruben, Mary Claire, Mark and Liz vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Live UEFA European Qualifiers
programme.desc: Italy v Norway (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from both teams concluding Group I match, held at Stadio Friuli in Udine. These two sides have been the dominant nations in this group, and it was the Norwegians who made a statement by prevailing 3-0 in Junes reverse fixture in Oslo thanks to goals by Alexander Sørloth, Antonio Nusa and prolific talisman Erling Haaland

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: Layton and Mr Wilford come to an agreement, and an exchange is made between the two trains. However, what passengers of both trains are unaware of is they will soon face a high-stakes revelation that could change everything

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host returns to invite another group of Hollywood A-listers and British TV big shots to chat about what theyve been up to recently. Hollywood great Demi Moore discusses starring in the critically acclaimed body-horror The Substance. Music superstar and actress Lady Gaga chats about playing Harley Quinn in Joker: Folie à Deux, while Oscar-nominated Irishman Colin Farrell reflects on taking the title role in comic-book villain show The Penguin. Actor-film-maker Richard Ayoade talks about his book The Unfinished Harauld Hughes, while Jack Savoretti and Miles Kane perform Bada Bing, Bada Boom, from Jacks album Miss Italia

programme.desc: A policeman is turned down for his dream job as a secret service bodyguard to the president. Action thriller, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods
